reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a good sized room, very helpful checkin and great breakfast in the morning before we flew to Hong Kong. First time that we have stayed at Heathrow airport prior to a flight, but would definitely do it again at this property.
reviews.title: Excellent night before flying

reviews.text: Stayed on business night of 8th March. Lovely hotel. Nice dinner with customers in their steakhouse. Food good. Facilities good. Staff great. Slightly pricey but it is Heathrow.
reviews.title: Nice hotel - DO NOT USE THEIR CABS

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Next morning I asked concierge for a cab to uxbridge road. 20 minute trip max and I was told leaving the cab the charge was £45. Yes, seriously. 6.7mile journey (according to google maps). Apparently they charge £18 for the taxi to the airport departures (3 miles). So, get your own taxi arranged.
reviews.title: Very nice remodeled Marriott

reviews.text: I think someone told us that it was recently remodeled. The interior was very modern and comfortable, as I would expect from the Marriott. Probably the best hotel room on this most recent trip. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, and I had everything I needed at the hotel, so I did not feel like I had to leave the place. We had dinner and beer at the bar, but there are two other restaurants you can go to on the 1st floor. Its very convenient to LHR and you can take the Hoppa bus to and from the airport in just minutes.
reviews.title: Convenient to the airport and a nice atmosphere

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 days on our way from Germany to Scotland. We used the hotel hoppa shuttle to transfer to and from the airport for our flights (which is much cheaper than calling a taxi). The concierge staff was very helpful in getting us into Central London in the most convenient and least expensive way. The breakfast that was included in our room price was extensive and the service in the restaurant was impressive. The fitness center and pool are very nice but the pool is so overly chlorinated that just being in the room for too long caused our eyes to burn. The ventilation in the pool area needs to be massively improved to make swimming a pleasant experience. Our room was large and pretty standard for a Marriott hotel. The mini fridge was not turned on but we wouldn't have purchased anything from the mini-bar anyway. All in all it was a pleasant stay and we'd stay here again.
reviews.title: Good nights sleep

reviews.text: ...........which was all I stopped by for. Cheerful and helpful staff but no black pudding. Pleasant atmosphere and parking free.
reviews.title: Great breakfast.....................

reviews.text: Modern, spacious, clean, efficient.
reviews.title: enjoyed this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Problem resolution: Upon arrival, it was discovered that my reservation was mistakenly booked by the 3rd-party travel website, Logitravel.fr, for the OTHER Marriott Heathrow ("Windsor"). No fault of the hotel; despite the need for some back-and-forth at check-in, Reception finally agreed to check us in to a room, and work out the problematic details the following days with the booking website Logitravel, and their partner Gullivers Travels.
reviews.title: Good for one night

reviews.text: Points for eventually "taking care of the customer".
reviews.title: Efficient airport hotel

reviews.text: We arrived here after a flight from Rome to stay over before heading back to the U.S. the next morning. The airport shuttle to the hotel (the Heathrow Hoppa), which covered a number of hotels, ran too infrequently, cost £4.50, and took over twenty minutes to get to the hotel. The hotel needs a better option. Upon arrival, however, the hotel is a welcome sight with its big, airy, American atrium and it's helpful staff.
reviews.title: Very good for what it is - an airport hotel

reviews.text: Our room, which was a king bed with a rollaway bed for our 11 year old son, was £99 for the night and ready on our arrival (rollaway included). It is a typical (meaning good and reliably functional) Marriott room. Even with the rollaway, it was not crampt, just a bit closer. The bathroom was also large and functional. After a week of generally smaller European hotel rooms, I found my 6'6' frame felt comfortable and already closer to home.
reviews.title: Excellent stay for morning flight

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only complaint is that the mattress was way too soft, although it did not bother my back as I expected it would.
reviews.title: Great for early morning Flights.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would gladly stay here on another layover night. Because Heathrow is so far from London, that is really why this hotel exists.And it does a damned fine job of serving that purpose.
reviews.title: mixed room nice but still the rip off for wifi and cabs

reviews.text: We needed a place to stay before a morning flight, and, as we're Marriott regulars, chose this property. We took a chance and arrived around mid-day, and they had our rooms ready for us already. So, we got to spend the afternoon in Kew Gardens, which is not far away.
reviews.title: Mixed - some things excellent, others poor

reviews.text: Marriott Heathrow is an OK hotel. It's a bit dated and needs some attention. Given its location and prices, I hope Marriott will do this soon as it's a reflection of the airport and the UK - tired and needs a bit of TLC.
reviews.title: This hotel's OK

reviews.text: Having stayed here at least 10 times and never got around to posting a review of this hotel.
reviews.title: Heathrow's Number One Airport Hotel

reviews.text: The facilities are excellent for an airport hotel. Comfortable beds, good choice of food in the hotel as well, there are 3 F&B outlets I can think of. The lobby is nice and airy lobby with atrium and lounge bar / coffee shop (they serve Starbucks).
reviews.title: Quiet for being so close to LHR

reviews.text: Staff are efficient and friendly whenever I've dealt with them but the real benefit of this hotel seems to be when you're a Marriott Rewards member and get the access to their executive lounge as it will make your stay a lot cheaper and if it's a one off I'd book an executive room as the facilities and internet access make up for it. The continental breakfast served in the lounge has enough choice to satisfy an early morning riser like myself and evening canapes always have something nice as well. Haven't ordered room service for dinner but breakfast has always been on time and hot which is not always the case in Europe I find!
reviews.title: Great experience

reviews.text: Overall a great hotel to stay if you're flying in or out of Heathrow and I've had to stay a couple of times for more than one night, there's a cheap train service to Paddington from Hayes which only takes 20 minutes into town. Another tip is that public transport buses (not the Hoppa) are free around the airport area and a bus stop is only a mere 3 minutes walk away.
reviews.title: A highly competent airport business hotel
